text: Robert Michael Miller, Jr. (September 28, 1956 â€“ October 1, 2020) was an American professional ice hockey player. He played 404 games in the National Hockey League between 1977 and 1985. He played for the Boston Bruins, Colorado Rockies and the Los Angeles Kings. He was born in Medford, Massachusetts. Miller died on October 1, 2020 at the age of 64 in Tampa Bay, Florida. ==References== Category:1956 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American ice hockey players Category:Boston Bruins players Category:Colorado Rockies players Category:Los Angeles Kings players Category:Sportspeople from Massachusetts Category:People from Medford, Massachusetts
title: Bob Miller (ice hockey)
